damus-io/damus.title: Redesign Ndb.swift interface with better build and crash safety
damus-io/damus.body:
## Summary

This commit redesigns the Ndb.swift interface with a focus on build-time safety against crashes.

It restricts usages of `NdbTxn`, `SafeNdbTxn`, and unsafe unowned values to be used only in NostrDB internal code. Interfaces that used those were replaced with synchronous borrow closure interfaces that borrow `~Copyable` objects to enforce lifetime rules and prevent spread of unsafe unowned values or LMDB transactions in the rest of the code-base.

This prevents dangerous and cra

damus-io/damus.title: Fix thread UI jumpiness
damus-io/damus.body:
## Summary

Since 991a4a8, the `make_actionbar_model` function introduced an async call to populate the action bar data.

This surfaced a pre-existing problem where the action bar model would reinstantiate in any SwiftUI render pass for the chat bubbles in `ChatroomThreadView`. This issue was not visible before because the whole computation happened directly on the main actor during the render, maintaining the illusion of a stable entity. Since the computation was moved to an async task (for

damus-io/damus.title: Fix profile crash
damus-io/damus.body:
## Summary

This fixes a crash that would occasionally occur when visiting profiles.

NdbTxn objects were being deinitialized on different threads from their initialization, causing incorrect reference count decrements in thread-local transaction dictionaries. This led to premature destruction of shared ndb_txn C objects still in use by other tasks, resulting in use-after-free crashes.

The root cause is that Swift does not guarantee tasks resume on the same thread after await suspension p

vitorpamplona/amethyst.body: workaround for https://github.com/hoytech/strfry/issues/164 Some relay implementation (strfry) returns a primitive instead of a "list of one" when relay supports only a single NIP. This causes an error on amethyst side and a broken UI. Sample json: `"software":"git+https://github.com/hoytech/strfry.git","supported_nips":1,"version":"1.0.4"` This workaround is a flexible serialiser that accepts both primitive or a list of one. planetary-social/nos.title: audited codebase for strict access control and mutability annotations #185
planetary-social/nos.body:
## Issues covered
https://github.com/verse-pbc/issues/issues/185

## Description
Audits the entire codebase (minus previews and unit tests) for strictest possible access control and mutability annotations. See the issue above for justification.

Basically it boils down to:
If it could be private, it should be private.
If it could be immutable, it should be immutable.

No intended visible or functional changes.

v0l/snort.title: Bun migrate
v0l/snort.body:
Large refactor:

1. Migrate from `yarn` to `bun`
2. Remove all or most legacy css files and use `tailwind`
3. Reduce complexity for query system
4. Split index into more smaller chunks for loading performance
5. Remove `system-web` dexie tables, rely on `worker-relay` for cache layer

This PR adds a new build configuration for phoenix.social that sets the app name to "Phoenix", following the same pattern as existing configurations (iris, nostr, meku, etc.).

## Changes Made

- **Added `packages/app/config/phoenix.json`** - New configuration file with Phoenix branding
- **Created `packages/app/public/phoenix/` directory** - Public assets directory with manifest.json, icons, and other required files
- **Updated configuration README** - Added phoenix to the list of available con

v0l/snort.title: [worker-relay] Add PRE and fix RE support.
v0l/snort.body:
Was treating everything between 10000 and 40000 as a Replacable Event, this effectively broke PRE's because any given d tag couldn't exist more than once in the worker relay, regardless of which pubkey it was from.

There wasn't any noticeable performance loss on a database with 20k events (other than the whole 20k events thing)

Todo:
- [ ] Don't store ephemeral events?

v0l/snort.title: [TIDAL Embeds] Add allow and sandbox attributes
v0l/snort.body: Playback won't work correctly without the `allow="encrypted-media"` attribute. Also added the sandbox attribute to improve security.

This is a first pass at implementing Nip42 Authentication.

I wasn't really sure where to put the auth function so I put it into the publisher since it has all of that type of logic there.
But I didn't really know how to get the publisher (or the event signing) into where the connection and AUTH message is handled.

There is probably a much cleaner way, maybe creating an event listener?

I figured I'd put down some code and test things out against my NIP42 relay and get some feedback on h

coracle-social/coracle.title: Change /help view nosrapps url to lowercase
coracle-social/coracle.body:
When going through the login flow using a remote signer, I noticed that the "Browse Signer Apps" link on the `/help` page was linking to the nostrapps site but wasn't loading any signer options. However, the same link does work on the `/login` page. Changing the `/help` page nostrapps url to all lowercase (same as on the `login` page) fixes the issue. So just a one character change for a small inconvenience...

I tested locally with chromium and firefox and it now works as expected.

coracle-social/coracle.title: Improve mute
coracle-social/coracle.body:
#498 

> Allow users to hide the "show x hidden replies" bit for muted notes

There is a new settings called "load_muted_replies", on by default, if turned off, it will hide the button

> Don't mute notes by the user's own pubkey

The only way to mute a note of your own is either to mute your own npub or that specific event id. If a word is muted and your note contain this word, it won't be hidden.

> Hide muted parents in feeds (sometimes a reply to a muted note will show up, just rem

coracle-social/coracle.title: Get rid of Hurdak
coracle-social/coracle.body:
Work in progress

Some hurdak (minor) functions do not yet have a equivalent in welshman, here is the list:

- ToTitle
- pluralize
- commaFormat (number to text formatting)
- quantify (commaFormat + pluralize)
- bytes (text to int formatting)
- round (Math.round, but support floating numbers too)
- filterVals (remove undefined keys in a map)

Let me know if I should add them to welshman or to a util folder in Coracle

Tested with MacOS & android. Need to test with linux & windows still

Run `adb shell 'run-as com.damus.notedeck ls -la /data/user/0/com.damus.notedeck/files/storage/accounts'` and observe nsec getting turned into pubkey, but you remain logged in as nsec. 

This implementation migrates nsec values from plain files into the secure store while keeping the user logged in.

damus-io/notedeck.title: Use JobPool for media loading
damus-io/notedeck.body:
Previously, for each media loading request (for both on disk and from net) needed a separate `std::sync::thread`. With many requests, this can cause alot of overhead. This PR makes it so all media loading requests go through the `JobPool`, and it is made easy to run combinations of synchronous and async jobs chained together for a single request. 
Additionally, apps can make their own job types which aren't tied to the media loading types by making a new `JobCache<K,T>` and passing the type as

v0l/zap.stream.title: Fix stream cards content overflow and bleeding issues
v0l/zap.stream.body:
This PR fixes the broken styling of cards below streams where content would bleed into other cards, particularly when adding NIP-30 emotes or NIP-23 long-form content.

## Issues Fixed

1. **Logic Bug**: The `isEmpty()` function in `preview.tsx` was incorrectly checking `s.trim().length > 0` instead of `=== 0`, causing it to return the wrong boolean value for empty strings.

2. **Content Overflow**: Cards lacked proper width constraints and overflow handling, allowing wide content (emotes, image

v0l/zap.stream.title: Allow full sats amount in zap messages, only shorten amounts with zeros
v0l/zap.stream.body:
Previously, zap amounts were automatically shortened using K/M/G notation for all numbers above 2000 sats, which made it difficult to see exact amounts in chat messages. For example, 2500 sats would display as "2.5K" instead of the full amount.

This change introduces a new `formatZapAmount()` function that only shortens numbers when they would result in clean divisions (no decimal places), while preserving the exact amount for all other cases.

## Changes Made

- **Added `formatZapAmount()` fun

v0l/zap.stream.body:
This PR adds fiat currency (USD) display to the stream earnings section on the dashboard, similar to how other components in the app show both sats and USD values.

## Changes Made

- Added `useRates("BTCUSD")` hook to fetch current Bitcoin exchange rate
- Calculate USD equivalent using the conversion: `sats * 1e-8 * rate.ask`
- Display USD amount below the sats amount when rate data is available
- Used `FormattedNumber` with currency formatting for proper USD display

v0l/zap.stream.body:
loadWhitelist seems to use `isHex` from Snort to determine whether each publisher string is a hex string or an npub string. 

The `isHex` function seems to check if a string is alphanumeric rather than if it's hexadecimal: https://github.com/v0l/snort/blob/aaa4b0de975986f083a469514feb194635139da5/packages/shared/src/utils.ts#L241-L248

Since npubs are all alphanumeric strings, the code misinterprets them as hex strings rather than as npubs.

This PR replaces the check with a simple check f

This PR implements listing expiration logic inspired by NIP-40 but modified to meet specific business requirements. Instead of having Relays delete expired events (standard NIP-40 behavior), we use a custom valid_until tag. This allows the frontend to flag listings as "Outdated" while keeping the historical record visible for both merchants and buyers.

MostroP2P/mostro.title: Fix for docker build
MostroP2P/mostro.body:
@grunch ,

this fixes the issue on build in gh actions for docker, I used feature `ureq` in lnurl-rs crate to remove use of  openssl.
Musl target has static linking and pulled in Openssl in gh actions creating the error.

`ureq` feature is blocking, but luckily we always use `reqwest` for http request, we use lnurl-rs just for url validation so
we can use it with blocking feature while using rust-tls feature on reqwest crate.

during my test on windows i noticed that we could remove openssl just using the supported featrure of reqwest crate rustls-tls, like this:

```Toml
reqwest = { version = "0.12.1", default-features = false, features = ["json", "rustls-tls"] }
```

I think it's a good move that will remove another dep using a stable rust lib like rusttls.

Tell me your opinion!

fiatjaf/nak.title: Allow --prompt-sec to be used with pipes
fiatjaf/nak.body:
This allows using `--prompt-sec` with pipes on Unix-like systems.

It uses `/dev/tty` as a workaround to accept the input if a pipe is used. On Windows an error message would still be displayed if `--prompt-sec` is used with a pipe.

I used Goose to make this change. It seems like an acceptable tradeoff to me, but if you think it's bad please feel free to pass on it. I am novice.

fiatjaf/nak.title: fix(decode): handle pubkey flag
fiatjaf/nak.body: nak decode's subcommand accepts a --pubkey flag to print only the pubkey if applicable instead of JSON, however it wasn't being used.

fiatjaf/nak.title: build arm binary for Raspberry Pi 32bit
specify how ; can separate multiple tag values
Allow setting private key via ENV variable
fiatjaf/nak.body: ENV variables are important for passing in secret keys so that they don't leak into command history and etc.  This simple patch allows you to set NOSTR_PRIVATE_KEY as an environment variable and nak will use this for various actions that require a key if not in bunker mode.

greenart7c3/amber.title: Preserve bunker encryption type on serialization
greenart7c3/amber.body:
### Problem Statement
  Persisted bunker requests weren’t storing their original encryption
  scheme. If a NIP‑04 request was queued and later rehydrated, Amber
  assumed NIP‑44 when replying. The remote client either rejected
  the response or, worse, received plaintext, violating NIP‑46
  expectations.

 ### Proposed Solution
  Serialize the encryptionType field inside AmberBunkerRequest so it
  survives round-trips, and add a unit test to lock in that behaviour.

  ### Benefits

fiatjaf/nos2x.title: Fix react misuse
fiatjaf/nos2x.body:
`showMessage` should not leave running timeouts in the background, and should pass a mutation-function to `setMessages` so in can be used multiple times in a row.

Also, when mutating state of arrays, the old arrays should not be changed because it might prevent `useEffect`s from detecting the change.

fiatjaf/nos2x.title: Support to scan/load qrcode
Deconstruct values of notification config from local storage of extension
fiatjaf/nos2x.body:
We didn't deconstruct the values stored in the extension's local storage. This caused the L99 to always be evaluated as truthy (`!!{} == true`), resulting in the notifications always (annoyingly) being sent through the browser regardless of the configuration (checked or unchecked).

I simply added the process of deconstructing, the same as in other places.

fiatjaf/nos2x.title: Enable support for .localhost tld domains
fiatjaf/nos2x.body: I use a .localhost tld in development when working on many websites throughout the day, the extension was failing on these websites due to the nostr-provider.js script not being accessible, I've added a rule which will match .localhost domains http://example.localhost http://another.example.localhost/auth/login etc... Without this rule, `window.nostr` will not be available.

fiatjaf/nos2x.title: Inject content script faster with document_end
fiatjaf/nos2x.body:
The default value for [run_at](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/reference/api/extensionTypes#type-RunAt) is `document_idle`, which injects the script at some random point of convenience after the page is loaded.

By setting it to `document_end`, it will inject the script immediately after the DOM is loaded, guaranteeing that window.nostr will be available as soon as the page loads.

This fixes problems with Ditto/Soapbox and nos2x (although I also [patched](https://gitlab.com/soa

hoytech/strfry.title: Add nodeinfo support
hoytech/strfry.body:
[nodeinfo](https://github.com/jhass/nodeinfo) is a well-known route used in decentralized social media, especially the Fediverse. I think adding nodeinfo to relays could open doors for greater interoperability across protocols, as it will help crawlers automatically discover Nostr relays to add to lists such as [FediDB](https://fedidb.org/).

This exposes routes at `/.well-known/nodeinfo` and `/nodeinfo/2.1`, similar to Mastodon: https://mastodon.social/.well-known/nodeinfo

jeffthibault/python-nostr.title: Track connection state, reconnect on error, outgoing message queues
jeffthibault/python-nostr.body:
This PR adds tracking for the conenction state of a Relay. 


In particular, when using multiple ralays of which some may be faulty and/or just slow, the method `Relay.publish` would try to publish independent of the connection state and raise `WebSocketConnectionClosedException: Connection is already closed.` 

This means that all publishing attempts on other relays after the faulty one would obviously also fail.

### Changes to `Relay`

#### New or changed attributes

In this PR, I

jeffthibault/python-nostr.title: Fix: `Event` dataclass update in #39
jeffthibault/python-nostr.body:
The last PR #39 with the change to the `Event` dataclass introduced a bunch of initialization problems that are fixed in this PR.

Duplicates parts of https://github.com/jeffthibault/python-nostr/pull/50 but with less changes. 

I suggest merging https://github.com/jeffthibault/python-nostr/pull/50 as well or instead of this PR.

jeffthibault/python-nostr.title: refactor RelayManager and Relay classes; add Request class
jeffthibault/python-nostr.body:
**RelayManager**:
- Allow subscriptions to be open on individual relays instead of all relays
- Automatically opens a connection when a relay is added
- Automatically sends a "REQ" message when adding a new subscription
- Automatically sends a "CLOSE" message when closing a subscription 

**Relay**:
- Add a proxy config member variable
- Add ssl_options as a member variable

**Misc**:
- Add Request class to encapsulate "REQ" message
- Add python-socks dependency (for proxy config)

jeffthibault/python-nostr.title: `EncryptedDirectMessage` class; simplify `Event`
jeffthibault/python-nostr.body:
_This one probably should have been separated out into 3-4 small PRs. I can pull these apart if need be._

## `EncryptedDirectMessage` class
Derived from the parent `Event` class to provide a more human-friendly way to construct a DM:

```python
from nostr.event import EncryptedDirectMessage

dm = EncryptedDirectMessage(
  recipient_pubkey=recipient_pubkey,
  cleartext_content="Secret message!"
)
private_key.sign_event(dm)
relay_manager.publish_event(dm)
```

holgern/pynostr.title: Fixed NotRenderableError in table rows
holgern/pynostr.body:
### Overview
This pull request addresses a bug in the showmetadata.py where `NotRenderableError` is thrown when attempting to add integer values to rows in a Rich table. The Rich library requires all objects added to a table to be renderable, usually as strings. However, in the current implementation, integers (and possibly other non-string types) are directly added to the table, causing an error.

### Bug Description
When executing the showmetadata.py, an error is thrown in the section wher

hzrd149/blossom.title: BUD-10: Add `blossom:<sha256>.ext` URI spec
hzrd149/blossom.body:
This would introduce a new additional `blossom:<sha256>.ext` URI that clients could use to embed more resilient links to blobs

The benefits to using a custom `blossom:` URI vs the existing `http://<server>/<sha256>[.ext]` URL
 - File extension is required
 - Optional blob size parameter 
 - May include multiple server hints
 - May include multiple author hints that can be used with BUD-03 to discover live servers
 - Clients must parse the URI and implement some form of server fallback

hzrd149/blossom.title: Change /media endpoint to require "media" auth
hzrd149/blossom.body:
This PR is technically a breaking change and would effect any client or server that has implemented BUD-05 to date

This changes the authorization type on `/media` endpoints to be `media` instead of `upload`. The reason for the change is to reduce the chance of a server re-publishing the original media blob to other servers using the `upload` auth event

hzrd149/blossom.title: Use cursor based pagination instead of date based pagination
hzrd149/blossom.body:
The date based pagination on the `/list` endpoint was a mistake and is barely useful. this PR replaces it with something more useful

[readable version](https://github.com/hzrd149/blossom/blob/list-pagination/buds/02.md#get-listpubkey---list-blobs-optional)

hzrd149/blossom.title: BUD-07 Paid storage
hzrd149/blossom.body:
### BUD-07 Paid upload and download

This pull request introduces `BUD-07`, a new specification outlining how servers can require and handle payments for blob storage. It defines the use of `402 Payment Required` responses, with payment details provided via `X-{payment_method}` headers adhering to method-specific standards like **Cashu (NIP-18)** and **Lightning (BOLT-11)**.

The specification is **designed to be extensible** for future payment methods and includes guidance on client-server

hzrd149/blossom.title: Add missing HEAD for CORS headers
hzrd149/blossom.body: This PR adds the missing `HEAD` method to the allowed methods header for CORS since BUD-01, and BUD-06 define `HEAD` endpoints

hzrd149/blossom.title: Add BUD-00 to define BUDs and common language
hzrd149/blossom.body: This PR adds a BUD-00 that defines common language and terms used in other BUDs

hzrd149/blossom.title: Clarify wording on BUD-04
hzrd149/blossom.body: This PR clarifies some wording in BUD-04 and adds some extra information

hzrd149/blossom.title: Clarify has blob endpoint in BUD-01
hzrd149/blossom.body:
This PR adds more clarification about how the `HEAD /<sha256>` endpoint should behave along with requiring it to return the same headers that the `GET /<sha256>` endpoint returns.

[RFC 7231](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7231#section-4.3.2) only states that:

> The server SHOULD send the same
> header fields in response to a HEAD request as it would have sent if
> the request had been a GET, except that the payload header fields
> ([Section 3.3](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7231

hzrd149/blossom.title: Clarify requirements around file extensions, Content-Type, Content-Length and redirection.
hzrd149/blossom.body: See Issue #69 for further details. This includes excerpts from #70 and #73 and, if agreed on / merged can likely replace both PRs.

hzrd149/blossom.title: Recomend range requests to BUD-01
hzrd149/blossom.body:
This PR adds a section to BUD-01 suggesting that servers support range requests on the main `GET /<sha256>` endpoint

fixes https://github.com/hzrd149/blossom/issues/37

hzrd149/blossom.title: Clarify root paths
hzrd149/blossom.body:
Updates the wording in BUD-01 to be more explicit about where endpoints should be accessible

Fixed #44

hzrd149/blossom.title: Require NIP-94 values to be strings
hzrd149/blossom.body:
This PR fixes the example and requires the values in the `nip94` object to be strings to match NIP-01 tags

Fixes https://github.com/hzrd149/blossom/issues/48

hzrd149/blossom.title: Update BUD-05: Add HEAD /media endpoint
hzrd149/blossom.body: This PR adds a `HEAD /media` endpoint similar to `HEAD /upload` in BUD-06 but for the `PUT /media` endpoint defined in BUD-05

hzrd149/blossom.title: modify BUD-02: require the file extension in the url field
hzrd149/blossom.body:
This PR makes the file extension required in the `url` field in the blob descriptor

The `url` field is intended to be a helper for clients to easily embed the blob in nostr posts or anywhere else so the file extension is useful

NOTE: The file extension in BUD-01 `GET /<sha256>` endpoint is still **optional**

hzrd149/blossom.title: Clarify authorization requirements in BUD-04
hzrd149/blossom.body:
This PR modifies the auth requirements in BUD-04 from "MUST" to "MAY"

It also clarifies that the authorization type that should be used on the `/mirror` endpoint should be an `"upload"` type. this was hinted at and was my original intention in the "Example Flow" but I neglected to explicitly mention it in the BUD

hzrd149/blossom.title: Use array for nip94 tags
hzrd149/blossom.body: NIP-94 cannot be an object as it can contain duplicate keys `image` / `fallback` etc

nostr-protocol/nips.title: Improve generic reposts for replaceable events
Update NIP-EE header formatting
nostr-protocol/nips.body: Like other NIPs, this helps with parsing for NIPs viewers

nostr-protocol/nips.title: update NIP-18 headings
nostr-protocol/nips.body:
Like other NIPs, this helps with parsing for NIP viewers

The head was good before a4dadca077645dcb3ceddc11dbe4982ce52196bc

nostr-protocol/nips.title: Complete removal of hashtag and url tags from bookmarks.
nostr-protocol/nips.body: This goes in the same line as #2133 , with the same rationale, but extending to kind 10,003 bookmarks as well.

nostr-protocol/nips.title: Improve NIP-C0
nostr-protocol/nips.body:
Fixes #2134 and #2135.

The description of the `license` tag is updated in reference to the  SPDX Specification, to allow for multiple licensing, to optionally include a reference to the full license tag and to specify that the license applies to other data too (such as the description, when provided).

The description of the `repo` tag is updated to allow for references to NIP-34 `kind:30617` relay announcements.

nostr-protocol/nips.title: NIP-51: Removes hashtags and `r` tags from bookmarks
nostr-protocol/nips.body:
1. Removes `t` from the generic Bookmark list because we have an exclusive kind for hashtag bookmarks: 30015 

2. Removes `r` from the generic Bookmark list because it should be its own kind, potentially with more appropriate NIP-73 labels instead of just `r` tags.

nostr-protocol/nips.title: Add self to NIP 11
nostr-protocol/nips.body: We already use `pubkey` in several places (at least NIP 29 groups) to verify events that are published by a relay. This breaks those use cases, but maintains compatibility with the user administrator use case.
